variant.question: In areas where a vertical separation minimum (VSM) of 300 m (1 000 ft) is applied, an IFR flight on a magnetic track of 350° would be expected to fly at:

options.text: FL400
FL105
FL115
FL410

variant.question: An Non-Transgression Zone (NTZ) for independent parallel approaches is;

options.text: at least 610 metres wide when the vertical separation between aircraft on adjacent approaches is less than 1 000ft.
at least 1 310 metres wide when the vertical separation between aircraft on adjacent approaches is less than 1 500 ft
a maximum of 610 metres wide when the vertical separation between aircraft on adjacent approaches is less than 1 000ft.
a maximum of 1 310 metres wide when the vertical separation between aircraft on adjacent approaches is less than 1 500 ft

variant.question: Where an operational advantage can be obtained, an ILS procedure may include a dead reckoning segment from a fix to the localizer. The DR track will:

options.text: intersect the localizer at 45° and will not be more than 10 NM in length.
intersect the localizer at 45° and will not be more than 5 NM in length.
intersect the localizer at 30° and will not be more than 5 NM in length.
intersect the localizer at 30° and will not be more than 10 NM in length.

variant.question: Which statement is correct regarding parallel approaches?

options.text: In independant parallel approaches radar separation is not applied. Instead there is a NTZ established between the localizer centre lines.
In dependant parallel approaches radar separation is not applied. Instead there is a NOZ established between the localizer centre lines.
In independant parallel approaches radar separation is applied and the minimum distance between aircraft on adjacent localizers is 2 nm.
In dependant parallel approaches radar separation is applied and the minimum distance between aircraft on adjacent localizers is 5 nm.

variant.question: What is the maximum intercept angle for aircraft being vectored to intercept the localiser for simultaneous indepedent parallel approaches?

options.text: 30 degrees
45 dgrees
20 degrees
15 degrees

variant.question: What is the correct definition of the no transgression zone (NTZ) used in the context of independent parallel approaches?

options.text: A corridor of airspace at least 610 m wide located centrally between the two extended runway centre lines. It extends from the nearer runway threshold to the point where 1000 ft vertical separation is reduced.

A corridor of airspace, maximum 610 m wide, located centrally between the two extended runway centre lines. It extends from the nearer runway threshold to the point where 1000 ft vertical separation is reduced.

A corridor of airspace at least 500 m wide located centrally between the two extended runway centre lines. It extends from the farthest runway threshold to the point where 1000 ft vertical separation is reduced.

A corridor of airspace at least 500 m wide located centrally between the two extended runway centre lines. It extends from the farthest runway threshold to the point where 1500 ft vertical separation is reduced.

variant.question: In a precision approach (ILS), the glide path interception generally occurs at heights above runway elevation between..
When parallel runway operations are in progress and a reduced radar separation of 3 NM between approaching aeroplanes is maintained, what type of operations are being carried out?

options.text: Mode 2
Mode 1
Mode 4
Mode 3

variant.question: When independent parallel instrument approaches are carried out into an aerodrome, it is required that the approaches are...

options.text: monitored by radar.
supported by radar vectoring.
are only conducted by turbojet aeroplanes.
conducted as visual approaches.

variant.question: What is an NTZ used for?

options.text: To protect aircraft conducting simultaneous parallel approaches.
It is an area on the runway which cannot be used for touchdown (No Touchdown Zone).
To indicate an area on an en-route chart where transponders are not required.
A sign to indicate pilots that this area does not belong to the terminal area.

variant.question: The purpose of the No-Transgression Zone (NTZ) is to...

options.text: protect aircraft that are carrying out independent parallel approaches.
protect aircraft that are carrying out opposite direction approaches.
give sufficient lateral separation for en-route traffic.
separate flights under VFR from flights under IFR on final.

variant.question: According to ICAO Doc 8168 (PANS-OPS), which of the following avionics are required to conduct a parallel instrument approach?

options.text: Normal IFR avionics including full ILS or MLS capability.
IFR avionics with LCD displays on the Commander's and Co-Pilot's sides.
A navigation system compliant with RNP APCH requirements.
A navigation system compliant with RNP-RNAV requirements.

variant.question: Independent parallel approaches may be conducted to parallel runways provided that a No Transgression Zone (NTZ) is established equidistant between the extended runway centerlines. The NTZ shall have a width of at least:

options.text: 600 ft

variant.question: Parallel operations where a runway is being used solely for arrivals and the other is used solely for departures is known as:

options.text: Segregated Parallel operations
Independent
Semi - mixed
Mixed

variant.question: According to ICAO Doc 4444, when an aircraft is radar vectored to an ILS localiser course, the angle between the interception course and the localiser course shall not be larger than

options.text: 45 degrees.
40 degrees.
35 degrees.
50 degrees.

variant.question: State the optimum glide path angle for an ILS approach if no obstacles or similar demand for a different angle:
The ILS obstacle clearance surfaces assume that the pilot does not normally deviate from the centerline more than:

options.text: ½ of scale deflection after being established on the track.
¼ of scale deflection after being established on the track.
1 and ½ dot deflection after being established on the track.
full scale deflection after being established on the track.

variant.question: Guidance material related to simultaneous operations on parallel or near-parallel instrument runways may be found...

options.text: In an ICAO Document.
In Part-FCL.
In standardised European Rules of the Air.
Attached to the Certificate of airworthiness.

variant.question: Using two parallel runways only for departures at the same time is known as...

options.text: Simultaneous mode
Segregated mode
Coordinated mode
Semi-mixed mode

variant.question: Rules regarding parallel runway operation are contained in:

options.text: ICAO Doc 9643
ICAO Doc 7475
ICAO Doc 9481
ICAO Doc 9613

variant.question: What are equipment requirements for parallel runway approach procedures?

options.text: PBN equipment, non-precision equipment, precision equipment.
Non-precision equipment and precision equipment.
Simple equipment and precision equipment.
PBN equipment, precision equipment, non-precision equipment and GNSS functions.

variant.question: When being vectored what is the maximum angle of interception for an ILS localizer CRS or MLS final APP Track in case of simultaneous independent parallel instrument approaches?
An airport provides two parallel runways where one is used for departures only and the other one is used for departures and approaches. What type of operation is this?

options.text: Semi-mixed operation.
Mixed operation.
Segregated operation.
Progressive operation.

variant.question: An airport provides two parallel runways where one is used for approaches only and the other one is used for departures and approaches. What type of operation is this?

options.text: Semi-mixed operation.
Segregated operation.
Mixed operation.
Progressive operation.

variant.question: An airport provides two parallel runways where one is used for departures and the other one is used for arrivals. What type of operation is this?

options.text: Segregated operation.
Progressive operation.
Semi-mixed operation.
Mixed operation.

variant.question: The No-Transgression Zone (NTZ) extends from ___ to ___.

options.text: the threshold of the nearer runway; the point at which 1 000 ft vertical separation is reduced between aircraft
the start of the approach; the touchdown point of the first runway
the nearer runway threshold; the point at which both aircraft are established on the centre line of the runways
the final approach fix; the end of the nearest runway

variant.question: Dependent parallel approaches may be conducted to parallel runways provided that the missed approach track for one approach diverges by:

options.text: at least 30° from the missed approach track of the adjacent approach.
at least 45° from the missed approach track of the adjacent approach.
at least 25° from the missed approach track of the adjacent approach.
at least 15° from the missed approach track of the adjacent approach.

variant.question: When an aircraft is vectored by radar to the localizer course, the angle between the interception course and the localizer course is normally 30°. In accordance with ICAO Doc **4444** it should not exceed a maximum of:
Two aeroplanes are approaching to land on parallel runways on independent parallel approaches and one drifts into the NTZ. What would the approach controller be required to do?

options.text: Issue appropriate control instructions to manoeuvre the threatened aircraft on the adjacent ILS approach.
Give instructions to the transgressing aircraft to turn away from the other traffic.
Advise the transgressing aircraft to break-off the approach and go-around.
Order the transgressing aircraft to climb immediately.

variant.question: For independent parallel approaches, when vectoring to intercept the ILS localizer course, the final vector shall enable the aircraft to intercept the ILS localizer course at an angle not greater than ___ degrees.

A minimum radar separation shall be provided until aircraft are established inbound on the ILS localizer course and/or MLS final approach track. This minimum is, when independent parallel approaches are being conducted:

options.text: 3.0 NM
2.0 NM
1.0 NM
5.0 NM

variant.question: A minimum vertical separation shall be provided until aircraft are established inbound on the ILS localizer course and/or MLS final approach track. This minimum is, when independent parallel approaches are being conducted:
What aircraft equipment is required to perform dependent parallel approaches onto parallel runways?

options.text: IFR navigation equipment with ILS/MLS capabilities.
Standard IFR navigation equipment.
RNP-APCH certified equipment.
RNAV/RNP certified equipment.

variant.question: What should an aeroplane have to conduct parallel approaches?

options.text: Precision approach capabilities, or meet the eligibility of MLS capabilities.
Non-precision approach capabilities, or meet the eligibility of PBN capabilities.
Precision approach capabilities, or meet the eligibility of PBN capabilities.
Non-precision approach capabilities, or meet the eligibility of VOR capabilities.

variant.question: In the case of parallel runways, each runway designation number shall be supplemented:

options.text: By a letter - for example 2 parallel runways L and R - for 3 L, C and R.
By a letter for 2 parallel runways.
By a letter - for example 3 parallel runways L and R and the central has no letter.
By a letter - for example 3 parallel runways "L" and "R" and the central has no letter.

variant.question: Independent parallel approaches are in force and two aircraft are both on parallel approaches. What would the controller be required to do if one aircraft were to drift into the NTZ?

options.text: Issue appropriate control instructions to manoeuvre the threatened aircraft on the adjacent approach.
Give instructions to the transgressing aircraft to turn away from the other traffic.
Advise the transgressing aircraft to break-off the approach and go-around.
Order the transgressing aircraft to climb immediately.

variant.question: When independent parallel approaches are being conducted and vectoring to intercept the ILS localizer course or MLS final approach track, the final vector shall be such as to enable the aircraft to:

options.text: Fly straight and level for at least 1 NM before intercepting the ILS localizer course or MLS final approach
Fly straight and level for at least 2½ NM before intercepting the ILS localizer course or MLS final approach
Fly straight and level for at least 3 NM before intercepting the ILS localizer course or MLS final approach
Fly straight and level for at least 2 NM before intercepting the ILS localizer course or MLS final approach

variant.question: Normal vectors to an ILS final give a 30§ intercept.   What is the maximum intercept angle according to ICAO Doc 4444?
On an aerodrome equipped with parallel runways, the designation number of each runway shall be supplemented as follows:

options.text: in case of two parallel runways by the letter "L" and "R" in the sequence from left to right.

in case of three parallel runways by adding "L" to the designation of the runway farthest to the left, adding one "R" to the central runway and adding two "R" to the designation of the runway farthest to the right.
in case of two parallel runways by adding "10" to the left runway designation and by subtracting "10" from the right runway designation.
in case of three parallel runways by the letter "L" and "R" for the outer runways and no letter supplement for the central runway.

variant.question: On an aerodrome equipped with parallel runways, the designation number of each runway shall be supplemented as follows:

options.text: In case of two parallel runways by the letter L and R in the sequence from left to right.
In case of three parallel runways by the letter L and R for the outer runways and no letter supplement for the central runway.
In case of two parallel runways by adding "10" to the left runway designation and by subtracting "10" from the right runway designation.
In case of three parallel runways by the letter A and Z for the outer runways and a C letter supplement for the central runway.
